related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: File Content Access Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* User experiences an issue where Pieces does not recognize file content without manual copy-pasting into the chat, even though it recognizes file names.
* User clarifies:
    * Long-term memory is enabled.
    * Both Claude and gpt foundation models exhibit the issue.
    * Issue occurs with all folders and files, including test files.
    * User uses Windows 11 Home, 24H2.
    * User works with 4 files, 3 of which have thousands of lines of code.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces cannot read content of large files directly, causing inconvenience for users.
* Difficulty reproducing the issue by developers.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Developer requests specific information and proposes call for further investigation.
* Developer suggests additional troubleshooting steps.
* Developer proposes alternative call with another team member.
* Developer mentions potential recent changes that may resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue's cause and resolution remain unclear.
* User scheduled a call with a different developer to further troubleshoot.

**Additional Notes:**

* User expressed appreciation for developer's responsiveness and willingness to resolve the issue.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) Disabled

**Key Points:**

- @Iliya3ProX reported that the LTM engine was not enabled on their Windows machine.
- The issue was due to a dependency for the LTM Engine failing to boot on @Iliya3ProX's machine.
- The issue impacted multiple users, including @AyomideA-S.

**Problems Identified:**

- Downloaded local LLM state overriding saved selected model data.
- Qdrant (a database used by the LTM Engine) failing to boot on affected machines.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Patch released to fix LLM state overriding issue.
- Investigating cause of Qdrant boot failure.
- Updating database infrastructure to improve performance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- @Iliya3ProX resolved the issue by reinstalling Pieces from the Microsoft Store.
- **Open Question:** Investigating the cause of the idle time expense reported by @Iliya3ProX.

**Additional Notes:**

- The issue was reported on December 19, 2024.
- The issue was marked as resolved on January 3, 2025.
- @Iliya3ProX reported a new issue with the PyCharm plugin on January 5, 2025.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation for malanciault **Key Points Raised:** * The issue was reported using the `pieces-support-bot`. * malanciault was unable to connect to Pieces OS with VSCode extension in DevContainer, even after trying the suggested solutions in the related issues. * malanciault confirmed that this problem occurred even with no VS Code project open. * robert-at-pieces informed malanciault that the default port for Pieces OS changed from 1000 to 39300 starting with version 11.0.0. * malanciault reported the problem continued after trying different port numbers. * It was determined that the main issue was that the Pieces server wouldn't listen to the address due to default settings for tighter security, causing a conflict when connecting remotely from a DevContainer. * The workaround for this issue would require complex DNS configuration. **Problems Identified:** * Unable to connect to Pieces OS from DevContainer using VSCode extension. * Default server listening interface changed, causing conflicts for remote connections. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * robert-at-pieces advised using the `http://192.168.0.129:39300` address. * A patch was developed for the VSCode extension to support changing the listening interface setting. * A workaround involving complex DNS configuration was suggested. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The patch has been released as version 2.0.1 of the VSCode extension. **Next Steps:** * malanciault needs to update the VSCode extension and try again. * If the issue persists, they can set up a video call with robert-at-pieces for further troubleshooting. **Additional Notes:** * The discussion took place between December 23, 2024 and January 7, 2025. * It involved several exchanges between malanciault and robert-at-pieces. I hope this summary is helpful!

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Summary: Network request failures flooding dev console **Key Points:** * Pieces OS update no longer uses a designated port, requiring checks against multiple ports. * These checks can result in network request failures that flood the developer console. * The failures are harmless and don't compromise user privacy. * Hiding the errors is preferred by the user for debugging purposes. **Problems Identified:** * Network request failures clutter the dev console, making it difficult to identify actual errors. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * **Initial solution:** Hide or handle errors from inactive Pieces OS port checks. * **Patch update:** Implemented a potential fix, but seems to be a Chrome bug. * **Workaround:** Users can hide network messages in dev console settings. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The Chrome bug may prevent a definitive solution. * Users can hide network messages, but it's not ideal. **Next Steps:** * Monitor the Chrome bug status for potential fixes. * Explore alternative solutions for hiding or handling the errors. ## Additional Notes: * The user appreciates Pieces OS but wants the issue addressed. * The developer is committed to finding a permanent solution.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* NafisMahmudAyon experienced an issue where messages weren't being sent to Copilot.
* Possible causes were identified as either PiecesOS crashing or VSCode losing connection.

**Problems Identified:**

* Communication between VSCode and Copilot was failing.
* Outdated version of the plugin was available on the open-source marketplace.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Isolate the issue by testing message sending in the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
* Debug the issue in real-time through a calendar link provided.
* Uninstall the outdated plugin and install the official VSIX version 2.0.0 from the marketplace website.
* Upload the latest version of Pieces for VSCode to Open VSX and automate the CI pipeline.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The latest version of Pieces for VSCode (2.0.1) is available on Open VSX.
* The issue is considered resolved with the available workaround.
* The CI pipeline is now automated for timely updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* Communication between the reporter and Pieces team was effective and timely.
* The issue was identified, diagnosed, and resolved efficiently.
* Continuous improvement is being implemented through automated updates.

related_issues.text:
Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension, VS Code, Sharing Web App

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.12

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I've been unable to generate shareable personal links and utilize the web sharing app since before June '24. I've created an issue about this twice before, and the last time was just completely disregarded and it was closed out.

Here is the screenshot from within my Pieces Desktop when trying to generate a personal link, as well as generate a GitHub Gist:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0966a1a9-3076-4d9b-9006-88a14673cc9f)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Shareable links not working for some users, causing frustration.

**Key Points:**

* Tombinga reported the issue and was frustrated by the problem.
* Mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and offered to help.
* They scheduled a meeting to discuss the issue and potential solutions.

**Problems Identified:**

* Outdated infrastructure impacting shareable links.
* Not all users were experiencing the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces diagnosed the issue and planned to clean up users' clouds experiencing problems.
* Additional infra upgrades and major updates were planned for December.
* A fix was implemented in Pieces OS v10.1.13, released around November 19-21st.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue appears to be resolved for most users.
* Tombinga is still experiencing issues with GitHub Gist generation.
* A new issue has been filed to investigate the persisting problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing issues should continue to reach out to the team for further assistance.
* Major upgrades to Shareable links and cloud features are expected in December.

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format"

**Key points raised:**

* User @workingCPU is experiencing the error "No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format" when trying to run the Pieces application.
* The user has not been able to run the application at all.
* The user is using Debian and has an NVIDIA graphics card.

**Problems identified:**

* The error message suggests an incompatibility between the application and the user's graphics driver.
* The application may not be fully compatible with Debian.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Try a different NVIDIA driver or use integrated graphics if available.
* Switch between x11 and Wayland display servers.
* Set the environment variable `LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1` before launching the application.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user has tried the proposed solutions but the issue persists.
* The developers are investigating the issue and will provide an update when available.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to Flutter, the framework used to develop the Pieces application.
* Similar issues have been reported on GitHub for other Flutter applications.

**Next steps:**

* The user can continue to monitor the issue for updates.
* The developers will continue to investigate the issue and provide a solution as soon as possible.

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3.

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving LTM issues:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around Pieces OS Long-Term Memory (LTM) issues. Focus on resolving these issues to reduce ticket volume and improve user experience.

**Improve remote environment connectivity:** Address the connectivity issues users face in remote environments like Docker and VS Code. This might involve clearer documentation, plugin updates, or configuration guides.
**Investigate Pieces OS 11.0.0 update issues:** Several tickets report issues specific to the 11.0.0 update. Investigate these issues thoroughly and provide solutions or workarounds.

**Enhance plugin compatibility and stability:** Address compatibility issues between Pieces OS and its plugins, particularly on Linux and Windows. This might involve working with plugin developers or providing more detailed compatibility information.

**Improve error messages and troubleshooting:** Provide more informative error messages to users and improve troubleshooting documentation. This will help users self-diagnose and resolve issues more effectively.

**Monitor plugin updates and compatibility:** Implement a system to monitor plugin updates and ensure compatibility with new Pieces OS versions. This can help prevent compatibility issues from arising in the future.

**Consider a dedicated Linux support team:** Given the recurring issues on Linux, consider forming a dedicated support team or assigning specific team members to handle Linux-related tickets more effectively.
**Gather user feedback on specific issues:** For complex issues like the LTM problems, actively gather user feedback and logs to aid in debugging and resolution.
**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds:** Maintain a public list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and reduce support requests for known problems.

**Automate support tasks where possible:** Explore automating repetitive support tasks, such as triaging tickets or providing basic troubleshooting steps, to free up support staff for more complex issues.
